item.name: Publishing Innovation Day Online
item.author: patelkir

additionalFields.contentTitle: Publishing Innovation Day Online
additionalFields.contentDescription: Join this online event to hear how publishers from across the globe have achieved their digital transformation. You'll learn about their successes, challenges, culture changes, and how the cloud has supported their journey.

item.name: Broadcast Transformation ebook
item.author: patelkir

additionalFields.contentTitle: Transform your broadcast technology on the cloud
additionalFields.contentDescription: In this eBook, examine how the cloud is transforming broadcast. Discover solutions from Amazon Web Services (AWS) and AWS Partners designed to enhance and improve the broadcast workflow, and read how real customers in the broadcast industry are succeeding by modernizing on the cloud.

item.name: Machine Learning for M&E ebook
item.author: patelkir

additionalFields.contentTitle: Engage your audience with machine learning powered experiences
additionalFields.contentDescription: In this eBook, we’ll demonstrate how your company can create engaging audience experiences through machine learning-powered solutions—and provide examples of other businesses in your industry that are creating fascinating, captivating experiences with machine learning today.

tags.name: Machine Learning & Analytics
tags.description: old tag - now use Data Science & Analytics

item.name: Broadcast in the Cloud Webcast
item.author: patelkir

additionalFields.contentTitle: Broadcast in the Cloud
additionalFields.contentDescription: From playout to primary distribution, statistical multiplexing to monitoring, discover how reliable distribution of 24x7 live video originating in AWS is in production today, and see how you can take advantage of the flexibility, agility, and scale of the AWS cloud.

item.name: Video Origination Services: Options, Trade-offs & How to Choose
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Video Origination Services: Options, Trade-offs & How to Choose
additionalFields.contentDescription: Learn about the design considerations, understand how to evaluate the trade-offs, and be confident in picking the right video origination service.

item.name: Security for Content & Media Workflows
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Security for Content & Media Workflows
additionalFields.contentDescription: In this 3 part webcast series, media and entertainment experts walk you through the questions, different approaches, important considerations, and the best proactive practices for securing your workflows so that the entire process is easy to implement, monitor, and manage.

tags.name: DAM & Supply Chain
tags.description: Old tag - now use Media Supply Chain & Archive

item.name: Digital Content Creation on AWS
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Digital Content Creation on AWS
additionalFields.contentDescription: Learn how creative studios can take advantage of the cloud to help with remote work, scale production pipelines, increase artist productivity, and reduce wall clock time to deliver projects. This five part series features presentations from Untold Studios, Hive VFX, Citesite, and a discussion hosted by postPerspective with NVIDIA, Tangent Studio, and AWS.

item.name: AWS Media Insights Webcast Series
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: AWS Media Insights Webcast Series
additionalFields.contentDescription: Join AWS media tech experts and customers for an online event exploring the latest media and entertainment innovations and solutions for content production, broadcast, OTT, and data science and machine learning. The 5-week series airs every Thursday from October 1 to October 29.

tags.name: Machine Learning & Analytics
tags.description: old tag - now use Data Science & Analytics

item.name: AWS Media Solutions Webcast Series
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: AWS Media Solutions Webcast Series
additionalFields.contentDescription: Watch this eight-part series that presents solutions from APN technology and consulting partners for media workflows. Sessions are organized into four categories: Content Creation, Content Processing, Content Distribution, and the application of AI & Machine Learning for Media.

item.name: Strategies for Successful Live Event Streaming and How to Avoid Mistakes
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Strategies for Successful Live Event Streaming and How to Avoid Mistakes
additionalFields.contentDescription: New video technologies make it possible for anyone to set up and run a live streaming video event. In this webcast, experts discuss the latest tools, tips, and considerations that organizations operating in any industry need to know to turn live event streaming concepts into pain-free productions.

item.name: Augmenting Full-Motion Video PED Analysis with Machine Learning
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Augmenting Full-Motion Video PED Analysis with Machine Learning
additionalFields.contentDescription: Warfighter analysis tools must be mission-critical ready for engagement at all times. Register for this webcast and learn how to extend your video encoding capabilities from ground and air operations to disconnected edge environments and to handheld mobile devices. Learn ways to improve processing, exploitation and dissemination with the latest artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies.

item.name: HEVC Migration, Fragmented MP4 and CMAF
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: HEVC Migration, Fragmented MP4 and CMAF
additionalFields.contentDescription: In this webcast, experts from AWS Elemental will highlight the history of HEVC, the benefits of migrating from AVC to HEVC, and what this transition means for video providers. Gain fundamental knowledge about the convergence of fMP4, CMAF and HEVC and the requirements to make the shift.

item.name: HEVC: The Past, Present & Future Explained
item.author: stokeand

additionalFields.contentTitle: HEVC: The Past, Present & Future Explained
additionalFields.contentDescription: The benefits of leveraging the exceptionally efficient video compression techniques of HEVC / H.265 – with no sacrifice to video quality – are well known. But Apple’s recent commitment to hardware support raises questions. In this webcast, we’ll explain how we got here, discuss the ways AWS Elemental implements HEVC, show you how our customers use it, and look at where HEVC is headed.

item.name: Foundational Concepts: Video Compression, Processing and Delivery
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Foundational Concepts: Video Compression, Processing and Delivery
additionalFields.contentDescription: In this webcast, you will learn how to create and deliver video over the internet, walk away with an understanding of video codecs, containers, popular delivery methods and content delivery networks, and learn about the latest trends in video compression and delivery.

item.name: Intro to QVBR: Quality-Defined Variable Bitrate Control
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Intro to QVBR: Quality-Defined Variable Bitrate Control
additionalFields.contentDescription: QVBR is your antidote for inconsistent viewing quality caused by video complexity. QVBR saves you up to 50% for both CDN egress and storage. How? It delivers constant video quality and wastes zero bits. It’s also easy, simple, and quick to configure. Join us for an in-depth discussion of how QVBR works, its uses, and its advantages.

item.name: Building Resilient, High-Quality Live Video Workflow
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Building Resilient, High-Quality Live Video Workflow
additionalFields.contentDescription: For many viewers, the allure of live streamed events provides the motivation to subscribe and renew. But for many content providers, guaranteeing live streaming success is the most challenging part of media operations.  Learn what you need to know to get live streaming right.

item.name: Machine Learning Fundamentals for Corporate Streaming Video
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Machine Learning Fundamentals for Corporate Streaming Video
additionalFields.contentDescription: With minimal effort, companies can use existing, sophisticated solutions to make their corporate streaming video workflows much more efficient, and without additional time, expense, and expertise.

tags.name: Machine Learning & Analytics
tags.description: old tag - now use Data Science & Analytics

item.name: Server Side Ad Insertion
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Server Side Ad Insertion
additionalFields.contentDescription: Is server-side ad insertion (SSAI) better than client-side ad insertion (CSAI)? How do they differ? Which works best for OTT content monetization? How does the cloud enable more scalable solutions? This white paper answers these questions and more.

item.name: Achieving Broadcast-Grade Low Latency in Live Streaming
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Achieving Broadcast-Grade Low Latency in Live Streaming
additionalFields.contentDescription: For a long time, OTT video streams over the internet have been lagging behind broadcast TV and social media by 15-30 seconds if not more. It's been a frustrating problem for both viewers and content providers. New knowledge, technologies, and practices are making long-standing video latency problems for live streaming a thing of the past.

item.name: Achieving Great Video Quality without breaking the bank
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Achieving Great Video Quality without breaking the bank
additionalFields.contentDescription: Video delivery over the internet or any other channel is more than a matter of getting content from provider to viewer. To your audience, it's all about the quality of the viewing experience. If your video quality standards aren't high, your audience immediately knows and may go elsewhere to find it.

item.name: Behind the Stream
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Behind the Stream
additionalFields.contentDescription: Behind The Stream is an online show designed for sports media broadcasters, athletic teams, and digital rights holders, brought to you by AWS video experts. Tune in to get insights, insider tips, and inspiration about how to use AWS media solutions for your next live streaming event.

item.name: Launch an OTT Service on AWS in as Little as One Day
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Launch an OTT Service on AWS in as Little as One Day
additionalFields.contentDescription: Launching a cloud-based DVR service is seemingly complex and time-consuming, but it is possible to launch a complete, professional cloud-based solution quickly and cost-effectively. Cloud-based DVR solutions can be deployed with traditional on-premises cable or IPTV headends, or with video workloads running entirely on AWS. Learn more from this AWS webinar for senior decision-makers.

item.name: Cloud-based DVR Technical Overview
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Cloud-based DVR Technical Overview
additionalFields.contentDescription: Governments, public agencies, educational institutions, and other non-media organizations can easily and cost-effectively launch a live streaming solution with the ability to record video for offline viewing. Learn more from this technical AWS webinar.

item.name: Over-the-Top: The cloud based path to innovation
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Over-the-Top: The cloud based path to innovation
additionalFields.contentDescription: The technology infrastructure you choose influences the degree of success you achieve in the increasingly competitive OTT video market. This e-book discusses the accelerating growth in OTT markets, compares hardware- and cloud-based approaches to creating live and on-demand OTT video workflows, and gives specific examples of companies that use cloud-based OTT video services.

item.name: Windows Migration for Media and Entertainment
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Windows Migration for Media and Entertainment
additionalFields.contentDescription: A new IDC report shows AWS remains the no. 1 cloud for Windows workloads. To accelerate your migration process, AWS has a special Windows Jumpstart Migration Assessment for M&E customers. Experts from AWS and Flexera explain the details in this webcast.

item.name: How to Monetize Your OTT Video using AWS Media Solutions
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: How to Monetize Your OTT Video using AWS Media Solutions
additionalFields.contentDescription: This webcast explains how you can use AWS media solutions to simplify the monetization process, and make money, while saving time, effort, and resources in the process.

item.name: Building & Implementing Scalable, Affordable VOD Solutions
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Building & Implementing Scalable, Affordable VOD Solutions
additionalFields.contentDescription: In this webcast, you see real-world VOD use cases and customer examples, and learn how to quickly build, adapt, and scale for peak workloads and popularity—without decreasing video quality, or adding technical or operational complexity.

item.name: How to Get the Most Out of AWS for Live Streaming Solutions
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: How to Get the Most Out of AWS for Live Streaming Solutions
additionalFields.contentDescription: This webcast covers the solutions that minimize the dangers of live streaming, and make dealing with fast-changing live video challenges much easier on your operations, resources, budget, and you.

item.name: Modernize Your Media Workloads
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Modernize Your Media Workloads
additionalFields.contentDescription: Machine learning for media applications: A powerful way to enhance existing and build new customer experiences, accelerate time to market, and reduce costs. Learn how in this webcast led by AWS ML experts.

item.name: Hear from video experts on the latest trends & learn how to deploy them using AWS
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Hear from video experts on the latest trends & learn how to deploy them using AWS
additionalFields.contentDescription: Most media industry trend reports can provide directional guidance on consumer behavior but miss practical applications for media technologists to solve short- to long-term challenges. In this webcast, we discuss how new video workflow solutions from AWS directly address the changes your business is going through. Learn how to quickly evaluate and take advantage of the right solutions for your specific needs.

item.name: 3-Part Webcast Series: Resilient Live Streaming Video
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: 3-Part Webcast Series: Resilient Live Streaming Video
additionalFields.contentDescription: Live content attracts large audiences and drives revenue. Live video streaming is a compelling part of an OTT offering, and when it is, you must ensure your customers get the best experience no matter what, or you risk losing loyalty and money. Learn how the AWS Cloud and AWS Elemental Media Services make building a highly available and reliable live video workflow possible in a new, more cost-effective and scalable way, with monitoring, alerts, and security.

item.name: AWS Insights Online Conference
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: AWS Insights Online Conference
additionalFields.contentDescription: Join AWS Insights for a free half-day online conference designed for media and entertainment leaders and builders, with content creation, media supply chain, and content distribution sessions.

item.name: The Practical Guide to AWS Media Services
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: The Practical Guide to AWS Media Services
additionalFields.contentDescription: AWS Media Services are designed to give you an easy path to cloud-based video processing and delivery. Virtually limitless capacity, performance to scale, the latest proven video standards, formats and protocols – and much more. Understand the benefits and learn how to deploy the services for discrete workloads or complete, end-to-end video workflows.

item.name: Live Video Delivery from the Cloud
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Live Video Delivery from the Cloud
additionalFields.contentDescription: For broadcasters using traditional video infrastructure, the cost and complexity of maintaining video operations is a necessary evil. But to advocate for a change for the better, broadcasters need sound business reasons. This paper explains how cloud technologies take high costs and complexity off the table, and create mutually beneficial provider and customer relationships.

item.name: Use the cloud to deliver great fan experiences
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Use the cloud to deliver great fan experiences
additionalFields.contentDescription: Nurturing digital relationships with fans means delivering “right-now” OTT live sports offerings that meet broadcast-grade. The cloud is the great equalizer, allowing anyone to deliver personalized experiences and cutting-edge apps for the superfan. This e-book explains how cloud media services and solutions can help you reduce video production costs, grow revenue, and tailor offerings to your specific audiences.

item.name: Accelerate your Media Workflows
item.author: ashllund

additionalFields.contentTitle: Accelerate your Media Workflows
additionalFields.contentDescription: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has designed purpose-built solutions to help you innovate and accelerate your media workflows. Read how existing AWS customers are using solutions across their media value chain, from content production through to asset management and distribution, and get ideas for your own creative studio.

item.name: Video Processing and Delivery Moves to the Cloud
item.author: narjason

additionalFields.contentTitle: Video Processing and Delivery Moves to the Cloud
additionalFields.contentDescription: As video quality, accessibility and utility skyrockets, how video providers create and deliver professional-grade video services changes dramatically. This e-book digs into the details behind the causes and effects of this shift. Learn about the benefits of moving video operations to the cloud, the pros and cons of conventional approaches, and tips for adapting to coming changes.
